page.title: 11HOUSING 1
page.content: The houses in this area vary in age. There are a number of houses built in the early nineteenth century . A number of cottages were built in the early twentieth century, and then very little building was done until the nineteen sixties. In the mid-sixties a speculative builder purchased a market garden, a poultry farm and a gravel pit in Woodseaves. He built eighty houses which are known as Glebefields and Barn Common. At the same time old peoples' bungalows were built on High Offley Road, and some Council houses were built on Dicky's Lane,also in Woodseaves. The only new building which is allowed at present is 'infilling' in gaps between existing properties. There is to be no further building in the village until l994.
